fields.description:
The initial full user directory synchronization with JIRA/Crowd, will not create the user_profile db rows, which other parts of the app expect to exist.

This can cause errors like:
{code}
Caused by: java.lang.NullPointerException
	at com.cenqua.crucible.notification.NotificationEvent.shouldNotify(NotificationEvent.java:104) [fisheye.jar:?]
	at com.cenqua.crucible.notification.NotificationEvent.createAndAddRecipient(NotificationEvent.java:77) [fisheye.jar:?]

	at com.atlassian.crucible.actions.create.EditReviewDetailsAction.execute(EditReviewDetailsAction.java:345) [fisheye.jar:?]
{code}

h2. Workaround
As a FishEye db user may have an access to more than one FishEye database on single db server then we may try to limit an access of FishEye db user to FishEye db only.
fields.summary: 4.0 upgrade may fail on Mysql with "Can't DROP 'cru_user'; check that column/key exists"

fields.description:
h2.Problem description
On update 3.10 -> 4.0 we create two "special" default groups {{fisheye-users}} and {{crucible-users}} with FishEye/Crucible global permissions respectively. This happens in {{com.cenqua.crucible.hibernate.upgrade.crowd.MigrateUserLicenses}}.

Further on, we add global permissions for all the groups in {{config.xml/security/crowd/resyncGroupsList}}. If user had {{fisheye-users}} or {{crucible-users}} defined there, we fail, because these groups have had the global permissions already added in {{#addDefaultGroups}}.

h2.If an update has failed
Once the update has failed because of {{fisheye-users}} or {{crucible-users}} groups, you first have to roll back to previous working version (3.10.3 or earlier) before continuing.

h2.Workaround for updating to 4.0.0 and 4.0.1
Before upgrading to 4.0, remove {{<group name="fisheye-users"/>}} and {{<group name="crucible-users"/>}} from {{config.xml/security/crowd/resyncGroupsList}}. Leave the other groups intact.

h2.Updating to 4.0.2
Provided you start from a working instance (not one that has failed to upgrade to 4.0.0/4.0.1), upgrading to 4.0.2 does not require any extra steps regarding this issue.

h2.Message on the first run

fields.description:
Greetings! There are issues centered around the old way of doing authentication for fisheye/crucible in that it uses a single auth link instead of being able to add multiple directories (including local) similar to how jira, confluence, and bitbucket function. 

One of the biggest issues is the lack of a local authentication directory. If the singular authentication directory goes down for whatever reason, it is impossible to login using a local account without changing XML and restarting fisheye, which is inconvenient and undesirable.  Also, when using mixed directories of incremental and full sync (normal connector vs "delegated" connector), they default to full sync when merged into a single crowd application link. Lastly, with multiple authentication sources we can run multiple crowd servers for redundancy.

Please investigate the modernization of the authentication system,  to make it more in line with the other apps. Uniformity really does count for something.
fields.summary: Modern Authentication Uniformity

fields.description:
h3. Summary
FishEye does not restart successfully due to timeout while waiting for plugin to enable.
Increasing the timeout does not resolve the problem.

h3. Expected Results
FishEye restarts successfully and the plugins are loaded.

h3. Actual Results
The below exception is thrown in the {{atlassian-fisheye-YYYY-MM-DD.log}} file.
{noformat}
ERROR [main ] com.atlassian.plugin.manager.PluginEnabler PluginEnabler-actualEnable - Unable to start the following plugins due to timeout while waiting for plugin to enable: com.atlassian.plugins.atlassian-remote-event-consumer-plugin,com.atlassian.plugins.atlassian-remote-event-common-plugin,com.atlassian.crucible.plugins.fecru-jira-dev-summary-plugin,com.atlassian.plugins.atlassian-remote-event-producer-plugin,com.atlassian.fecru.fecru-analytics-plugin
{noformat}
_Note:_ that the plugin names vary depending on the installed ones.

h3. Environment
This has been reported on FishEye version 3.9.0.
According to the [UPM versions|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.atlassian.upm.atlassian-universal-plugin-manager-plugin/versions], the UPM version should be 2.17 for FishEye 2.7.13 - 3.4.7.

h3.Workaround
The list of available workarounds are available on the [Error message after upgrade/restart - Timeout exceeded waiting for service|https://confluence.atlassian.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=283642041] page.
This is the first one to be applied:
# Shutdown FishEye.
# Backup and delete the contents of the following folders:
{{<FISHEYE_INST>/var/plugins}}
{{<FISHEYE_INST>/var/osgi-cache}}
#Start FishEye (this will recreate the above folders minus any individually downloaded plugins).

h3.Notes
This has been originated from the [PLUG-1183|https://ecosystem.atlassian.net/browse/PLUG-1183] ticket.
fields.summary: FishEye does not successfully restart due to timeout while waiting for plugin to enable

h3. Summary
After restoring a FishEye backup to an Oracle database, the ORA-00955 error may be presented when trying to create AO tables.

h3. Environment
* Oracle database, configured according to [https://confluence.atlassian.com/fisheye/migrating-to-oracle-298976836.html]

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Have a FishEye backup.
# Restore it pointing to an Oracle database.

h3. Expected Results
* Migration completes succesfully and the application runs fine.

h3. Actual Results
FishEye may fail after some time, with the following showing up in the logs:
{noformat}
** Creating table 'AO_2913F5_COMMENT_ISSUE'
ERROR: problem running command
java.lang.reflect.InvocationTargetException
        at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method)
        at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(NativeMethodAccessorImpl.java:62)
        at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:43)
        at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:497)
        at com.cenqua.fisheye.FishEyeCtl.mainImpl(FishEyeCtl.java:101)
        at com.cenqua.fisheye.FishEyeCtl.main(FishEyeCtl.java:44)
Caused by: com.atlassian.activeobjects.spi.ActiveObjectsImportExportException: There was an error during import/export with plugin Inline Issue Creation Plugin for Crucible(com.atlassian.crucible.plugins.jira-ril) #3.5.5-raabb646 (table AO_2913F5_COMMENT_ISSUE):Error executing update for SQL statement 'CREATE SEQUENCE "AO_2913F5_COMMENT_ISSUE_ID_SEQ" INCREMENT BY 1 START WITH 1 NOMAXVALUE MINVALUE 1'
        at com.atlassian.activeobjects.backup.ImportExportErrorServiceImpl.newImportExportSqlException(ImportExportErrorServiceImpl.java:30)
        at com.atlassian.activeobjects.backup.SqlUtils.onSqlException(SqlUtils.java:53)
        at com.atlassian.activeobjects.backup.SqlUtils.executeUpdate(SqlUtils.java:42)
        at com.atlassian.activeobjects.backup.ActiveObjectsTableCreator.create(ActiveObjectsTableCreator.java:84)
        at com.atlassian.activeobjects.backup.ActiveObjectsTableCreator.create(ActiveObjectsTableCreator.java:62)
        at com.atlassian.dbexporter.importer.TableDefinitionImporter.doImportNode(TableDefinitionImporter.java:50)
        at com.atlassian.dbexporter.importer.AbstractImporter.importNode(AbstractImporter.java:49)
        at com.atlassian.dbexporter.DbImporter.importData(DbImporter.java:73)
        at com.atlassian.activeobjects.backup.ActiveObjectsBackup.restore(ActiveObjectsBackup.java:158)
        at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method)
        at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(NativeMethodAccessorImpl.java:62)
        at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:43)
        at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:497)
        at com.atlassian.applinks.host.OsgiServiceProxyFactory$DynamicServiceInvocationHandler.invoke(OsgiServiceProxyFactory.java:111)
        at com.sun.proxy.$Proxy27.restore(Unknown Source)
        at com.atlassian.crucible.migration.item.ActiveObjectsBackup$ActiveObjectsRestorer.restore(ActiveObjectsBackup.java:122)
        at com.cenqua.fisheye.ctl.Restore.run(Restore.java:197)
        at com.cenqua.fisheye.ctl.Restore.main(Restore.java:273)
        ... 6 more
Caused by: java.sql.SQLSyntaxErrorException: ORA-00955: name is already used by an existing object
{noformat}

h3.Workaround
# Identify the sequence that is causing the error - this can be done by reviewing the error in the logs. You may find the problematic sequence as follows:
{noformat}
<CREATE SEQUENCE "AO_60DB71_ISSUERANKING_ID_SEQ" INCREMENT BY 1 START WITH 1 NOMAXVALUE MINVALUE 1>
{noformat}
# Stop FishEye/Crucible.
# Have your Oracle DBA deleting the existing sequence.
# Start FishEye/Crucible.

*Note*: the process above may need to be repeated further times if FishEye presents errors for other sequences. It should seize failing again after all the problematic sequences have been deleted.
fields.summary: ORA-00955 after restoring a backup

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Email notifications for repository updates will show inconsistent content (no or incomplete updates) for large files that do not qualify to have their content indexed based on the [Text File Size Limit Set|https://confluence.atlassian.com/fisheye/text-file-size-limiting-298976914.html] in the application.

h3. Environment
Tested on CVS repository with large files (~100MB)
Email notifications configured correctly in Fisheye for this repository
Mail Server setup correctly in the application

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Make a commit to a CVS repository consisting of 10 large files (~100MB)
# Wait until it has been indexed by Fisheye
# Check the repository updates in the application UI to confirm that the new files are now visible in Fisheye
# Check notification email and notice that they are either missing altogether or some of the files in the above commit are missing

h3. Expected Results
Email Notifications include the complete update on this repository

h3. Actual Results
Missing files in the email update. As per the attached screenshot, instead of the 10 files committed to the repository, only 2 are being reported in the email notification.
 
h3. Notes
This seems to affect only large files that hit the file size limit set in the application for content indexing. There corresponding messages are reported in the {{atlassian-fisheye-<date>.log}} logs:
{noformat}
2016-03-04 14:30:23,138 WARN  - [CVS] MyCVSProject/fisheye-1.out@1.1 exceeds indexing size limit (101M, limit is 100K).  The contents of this file won't be searchable in FishEye.
2016-03-04 14:30:25,711 WARN  - [CVS] MyCVSProject/fisheye-10.out@1.1 exceeds indexing size limit (101M, limit is 100K).  The contents of this file won't be searchable in FishEye.
2016-03-04 14:30:26,365 WARN  - [CVS] MyCVSProject/fisheye-2.out@1.1 exceeds indexing size limit (101M, limit is 100K).  The contents of this file won't be searchable in FishEye.
2016-03-04 14:30:26,993 WARN  - [CVS] MyCVSProject/fisheye-3.out@1.1 exceeds indexing size limit (101M, limit is 100K).  The contents of this file won't be searchable in FishEye.
2016-03-04 14:30:28,156 WARN  - [CVS] MyCVSProject/fisheye-4.out@1.1 exceeds indexing size limit (101M, limit is 100K).  The contents of this file won't be searchable in FishEye.
2016-03-04 14:30:28,747 WARN  - [CVS] MyCVSProject/fisheye-5.out@1.1 exceeds indexing size limit (101M, limit is 100K).  The contents of this file won't be searchable in FishEye.
2016-03-04 14:30:29,386 WARN  - [CVS] MyCVSProject/fisheye-6.out@1.1 exceeds indexing size limit (101M, limit is 100K).  The contents of this file won't be searchable in FishEye.
2016-03-04 14:30:30,110 WARN  - [CVS] MyCVSProject/fisheye-7.out@1.1 exceeds indexing size limit (101M, limit is 100K).  The contents of this file won't be searchable in FishEye.
2016-03-04 14:30:30,816 WARN  - [CVS] MyCVSProject/fisheye-8.out@1.1 exceeds indexing size limit (101M, limit is 100K).  The contents of this file won't be searchable in FishEye.
2016-03-04 14:30:31,427 WARN  - [CVS] MyCVSProject/fisheye-9.out@1.1 exceeds indexing size limit (101M, limit is 100K).  The contents of this file won't be searchable in FishEye.
{noformat}
But the results are sporadic or unpredictable. Sometimes the entire update is missing and at other times there are incomplete updates with few files in the same commit missing in the notification.

h3.Workaround
Increase the [text file size limit|https://confluence.atlassian.com/fisheye/text-file-size-limiting-298976914.html] in the application to ensure the large files being committed are being indexed by Fisheye/Crucible.
fields.summary: Email notifications for repository updates missing information sporadically for large files

fields.description:
Greetings Atlassian,

I recently used a workaround posted on your site for an issue with naming in Fisheye:
FishEye users get disabled after username change in LDAP
https://confluence.atlassian.com/fishkb/fisheye-users-get-disabled-after-username-change-in-ldap-770609556.html?continue=https%3A%2F%2Fconfluence.atlassian.com%2Ffishkb%2Ffisheye-users-get-disabled-after-username-change-in-ldap-770609556.html&application=cac

I can only speak for the MySQL version of the workaround, but one of the DELETE statements has an invalid field that causes far greater data to be deleted than what is intended. The statement in question is:
DELETE FROM cru_file_read_status WHERE cru_participant IN (SELECT cru_participant FROM cru_review_participant WHERE cru_user = @old_user_id);

In the SELECT statement, cru_participant is an invalid field of cru_review_participant. That field SHOULD be cru_participant_id. Since cru_participant IS a field of cru_file_read_status, the DELETE will affect far greater records than it should. 

Example:
Bad query
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
{noformat}
mysql> SELECT count(*) FROM cru_file_read_status WHERE cru_participant IN (SELECT cru_participant FROM cru_review_participant WHERE cru_user = 2105);
+----------+
| count(*) |
+----------+
|   429952 |
+----------+
1 row in set (0.93 sec){noformat}

Good query
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ 
{noformat}
mysql> SELECT count(*) FROM cru_file_read_status WHERE cru_participant IN (SELECT cru_participant_id FROM cru_review_participant WHERE cru_user = 2105);
+----------+
| count(*) |
+----------+
|     4919 |
+----------+
1 row in set (1.72 sec)
 
mysql> 
{noformat}
Luckily, per the instructions provided(as well as standard good-practice), we took a backup before hand. However, I would hate for someone else to have to run into this issue.
fields.summary: Workaround is invalid and can lead to massive data loss

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

When using the Windows Installer to install FishEye on Windows the service is created but the user designated to run it is the 'Local System User'.

The [documentation recommends|https://confluence.atlassian.com/fisheye/installing-fisheye-on-windows-298976960.html]:

{quote}
2. Create a dedicated FishEye user (recommended)

For production installations, we recommend that you create a new dedicated Windows user that will run FishEye on your system. This user:
- Should not have admin privileges.
- Should be a non-privileged user with read, write and execute access on the FishEye install directory and instance (data) directory. These directories are described below.
- Should only have read access to your repositories. 

{quote}

h3. Suggested Solution

Set the user to run the Service as the dedicated user that's been created runs the installer.
 
h3. Workaround 

After the installer has completed manually change the user for the service from the command line:

{noformat}
sc.exe config "[servicename]" obj= "[.\username]" password= "[password]"
{noformat}
fields.summary: Windows Installer for FishEye sets the service user as Local System

fields.description:
h3. Summary
The committer information is not displayed correctly when accessing a changeset in case the user contains an underscore in its username. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
The steps below have been tested with a Git repository, but they may apply to other repository types.
# Create a user in FishEye with {{yut}} as Username, {{Yut}} as Display name and {{yut@fisheye.com}} as Email
# Create a user in FishEye with {{y_t}} as Username, {{Y_t}} as Display name and {{y_t@fisheye.com}} as Email
# These are the users in FishEye after the steps above !FE6359_users.png|thumbnail! 
# In a Git repository, set the Git configuration option for user.name and user.email to match the user with the underscore so that the Git config -l command returns:
-- {noformat}
git config -l
user.name=Y_t
user.email=y_t@fisheye.com
{noformat}
# Commit and push to the Git repository. The Git log command returns {{Y_t}} as Author:
-- {noformat}
git log <commit_hash>
commit ae59dba0943811fdbcbd76ab0f2e1938e87b9c1d
Author: Y_t <y_t@fisheye.com>
Date:   Tue Feb 9 11:30:17 2016 +1100
{noformat}
# Locate the commit in FishEye

h3. Expected Results
The {{Y_t}} display name, matching the {{y_t}} user, is displayed as committer.

h3. Actual Results
The {{Yut}} display name, matching the {{yut}} user, is displayed as committer.
 !FE6359_repositoryActivity.png|thumbnail! 

When clicking on the user displayed, the page containing the details of the {{yut}} user (without the underscore) is loaded (note the {{<FishEye url>/user/yut}} in the title bar), and the page shows the "This user has not yet committed." message:
 !FE6359_YutUser.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Notes
The user creation sequence ({{yut}} - user without the underscore before {{y_t}} - user with the underscore) is critical. If the users are created in the reversed sequence, then the problem does not occur.

h3.Workaround
Delete the user shown instead of the expected one, {{yut}} in this example, and recreate it.
The correct username is displayed after the user {{yut}} is deleted, and recreated:
!FE6359_correctRepositoryActivity.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: FishEye displays an incorrect committer for a user with an underscore in its username

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently we recommend installing Git on Windows with the "Use Git and optional Unix tools from the Windows Command Prompt" option when installing Msysgit, this adds a sh interpreter and all of the unix utils to PATH.

However there are valid use cases for not wanting to have an sh interpreter/unix utils in PATH - for example if a a single user is running all applications on the server, the overwriting of command line tools such as "find" can have an impact on other applications run by the user.

FishEye assumes that you are able to execute .sh files, which in turn demands that the unix system utils being in PATH.

h3. Suggested Solution

Provide a way to not have to need a sh interpreter and all of the unix utils to PATH.
fields.summary: Remove FishEye's need for a sh interpreter for use with git/ssh on Windows

fields.description:
It seems that in some cases the jsp classes in $FISHEYE_INST won't be overwritten on upgrades (potentially because their dates is newer than the date on the jsps in the release). This can cause errors when trying to render the UI.

We should probably delete the compiled JSPs from $FISHEYE_INST when an upgrade occurs, to make sure they are not left over.

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Once each reviewer has added a comment to a review and marked it as completed (as explained on the [Completing your review|https://confluence.atlassian.com/crucible/completing-your-review-298977450.html] page), FishEye/Crucible notifies the moderator via email (if configured).
This occurs immediately or batched for each reviewer completing the review.

h3. Suggested Solution
FishEye/Crucible allows, ideally through an additional option, to only sends a notification email once all reviewers completed the review.

h3. Workaround 
Enable the batch notification by setting the ["Comment reply added" setting|https://confluence.atlassian.com/fisheye/changing-your-user-profile-298976815.html] to "Batch". By doing so FishEye will not send an email every time a review is completed by a reviewer, it will roll up all the changes occurred in the previous timeframe into a single digest email.
fields.summary: As a review moderator, I want to receive an email notification only when all the reviewers have completed the review, so that I can check their comments in a single timeframe

fields.description:
*Problem:*

When the subversion repository is being indexed, in the last revision processed FishEye also calculates blame data for all revisions which does not have this data yet. In case of initial scan it means that blame is calculated for ALL changesets. 

Due to a fact that we have one indexing thread per repository, FishEye cannot find and index the latest revisions which have been committed to the repository in the meantime. In case of large repositories it may take many days until newly added changesets will become visible.

!svn_indexing.PNG!

 

*Workaround:*

(i) Atlassian confirmed it worked in FishEye 3.10.x. It might not work in other versions.

Stop and start the repository. Thanks to this, FishEye will find new changesets, index them and resume calculation of the blame data resuming from the last changeset processed. This can be accomplished manually or via REST API:

{code}http://host:port/context/rest-service-fecru/admin/repositories/{name}/start [PUT]
http://host:port/context/rest-service-fecru/admin/repositories/{name}/stop [PUT]{code}

For reference: https://docs.atlassian.com/fisheye-crucible/latest/wadl/fecru.html
 

*Proposed fix:*
 * process blame data in chunks in the initial scan, so that blame processing work could be interleaved with indexing of new changesets
 * add a fifth progress bar (e.g. named "Calculating blame") in the "Indexing activity details" in order to fix the false impression that FishEye hanged on processing the last revision in the "Changesets done"
fields.summary: Initial indexing of SVN repository can take long time due to blame calculation and block incremental scans

h3. Summary
[--Xno-slurp option|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/FISHEYE/Command-line+options] does not work - it still polls repositories regularly

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Install FishEye 3.10.3
# Start FishEye by the command "<FishEyeInstallDir>/bin/fisheyectl.sh start \-\-Xno-slurp \-\-debug (\-\-debug is just for debugging purpose)
# Add any repository
# You will see FishEye regularly polls the repository even after the initial index is completed

h3. Expected Results
FishEye stops regular polling when --Xno-slurp is specified

h3. Actual Results
FishEye continues regular polling even when --Xno-slurp is specified. You will see the following log in atlassian-fisheye-YYYY-mm-DD.log file:
{noformat}
...
2016-01-27 12:32:02,329 INFO  [main ] fisheye BaseCommand-handleCommonArguments - FishEye arguments: [--Xno-slurp, --debug]
2016-01-27 12:32:02,331 INFO  [main ] fisheye BaseCommand-handleCommonArguments - Starting with --Xno-slurp
2016-01-27 12:32:02,341 INFO  [main ] fisheye BaseCommand-handleCommonArguments - Starting with --debug. Logging will be at debug level.
...
2016-01-27 13:04:29,461 INFO  [IncrPing3 [REPO_NAME] ] fisheye Svn2Scanner-doSlurpTransaction - Starting slurp of [REPO_NAME]
2016-01-27 13:04:29,461 DEBUG [SvnExecution1 [REPO_NAME] ] fisheye SvnTask$1-run - Executing (IncrPing3 [REPO_NAME]) svn info -r HEAD [SVN_REPO]/@HEAD
2016-01-27 13:04:29,461 DEBUG [IncrPing3 [REPO_NAME] ] fisheye RepositoryStatus-setMessage - Status change [[REPO_NAME]]: Obtaining changeset list
2016-01-27 13:04:29,462 DEBUG [IncrPing3 [REPO_NAME] ] fisheye Svn2WrapUpProcessor-process - Started wrapup processing: startRevision=11, lastScannedCsid=10

fields.description:
h4. Summary

When filtering Users in FishEye using a literal {{_}}, the underscore is interpreted as a wildcard which returns undesirable filter results.
!Screen Shot 2016-01-26 at 09.52.20.png|thumbnail!

h4. Steps to reproduce

# Login to FishEye and go to Admin -> Users.
# If not present already, add users with similar user names. In this case, users y_hei, yah and yeh were added.
# Add y_h to filter.

h4. Expected Results

Only the y_hei user is returned.

h4. Actual Results

All 3 users are returned (see screenshot attached).

h4. Workaround
_Only available from the FishEye version 3.10.3._
The {{_}} character can be escaped with a backslash in the filter. Escaping the underscore causes the filter to return the expected result. (see following screenshot)
 !Screen Shot 2016-01-26 at 09.30.41.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: FishEye interprets underscore and percent as a wildcard in Users filter

fields.description:
If JIRA's Base URL does not match the URL used by AppLinks remote events are dropped silently.
JIRA publishes via REST the event capabilities it can handle with their corresponding URL. Said URL is created using the application's Base URL. When that URL does not match the AppLinks URL the event cannot be sent and the error is not logged.

This might result in delayed updates about development information in the JIRA development panel.
fields.summary: Remote events fail silently if Base URL does not match Application Link URL

Also, in order to be able to access the details of the ticket, a dedicated login to the https://jira.go2group.com website (not the Atlassian one) is required.

fields.description:
I recently upgraded Fisheye to 3.10 and i am trying to add the git repositories from Stash/Bitbucket to fisheye.

i have create app link with 2 legged oauth authentication. looks like its the SSH key pair part that is causing this issue. 

i can see all the repositories in Bitbucket server tab. but when i add the repo i get the below 
error.
Fisheye in in windows server and Stats/bitbucket is in Linux box.

with HTTP protocol i am able to access the repositories by passing the credentials for the service account. but it is very tedious since we have many repositories d we cannot set for all of the repositories

I am getting below error.
Tue Jan 12 13:16:01 EST 2016: Unable to clone remote repository: ssh://git@prdstash:7999/escm/firm.jira.status.board.git - [cygwin warning:, MS-DOS style path detected: F:\FishEye\fisheye-inst\bin\fe-ssh.sh, Preferred POSIX equivalent is: /cygdrive/f/FishEye/fisheye-inst/bin/fe-ssh.sh, CYGWIN environment variable option "nodosfilewarning" turns off this warning., Consult the user's guide for more details about POSIX paths:, http://cygwin.com/cygwin-ug-net/using.html#using-pathnames, F:\FishEye\fisheye-inst\bin\fe-ssh.sh: line 7: exec: C:\cygwin64\bin\ssh.exe: not found, fatal: The remote end hung up unexpectedly] - Cloning into bare repository 'clone'.


Please advice what could be the issue.

fields.description:
h3. Summary
In FishEye, in the {{Reports}} tab of a repository, if you select a branch or tag from the filter list, it attempts to load, but defaults back to {{All branches and tags}}, and the filter is not applied.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to a repository in FishEye.
# Select a branch or a tag from the filter list. The filter is not applied.

h3. Expected Results
The filter should be applied.

h3. Actual Results
The filter attempts to be applied, but reverts back to {{All branches and tags}}.

h3.Workaround
There is currently no workaround for this issue.
fields.summary: Branch/Tag Filter in Reports Tab Does Not Work

fields.description: Seems incomplete and thus causing confusion.  See FE-6306 for instance, it was not clear it is possible to retrieve and update start revision for svn repository.  Can we document examples for each scm with all their specific attributes?

fields.description:
h4. Summary

If the JIRA User Server isn't configured to permit the IP address of the FishEye/Crucible server an error message is displayed that instructs users to "Go to JIRA home".

h4. Expected result

Provide useful instructions to correct the problem:

{noformat}
Problem communicating with JIRA: Forbidden (403) Encountered a "403 - Forbidden" error while loading this page. In JIRA, ensure the IP address of the FishEye/Crucible server and any intermediary proxies have been added to the JIRA User Server connector for this application. {noformat}

h4. Actual result

The message instructs the user to go to JIRA home:

{noformat}
Problem communicating with JIRA: Forbidden (403) Encountered a "403 - Forbidden" error while loading this page. Go to JIRA home{noformat}

fields.summary: Provide actionable in app instructions to correct Crowd sync failure (403 - Forbidden)

fields.description:
h4. Summary

If the JIRA User Server isn't configured to permit the IP address of the FishEye/Crucible server an error message is displayed that isn't properly encoded.

h4. Expected result

The message is correctly encoded:

{noformat}
Problem communicating with JIRA: Forbidden (403) Encountered a "403 - Forbidden" error while loading this page. Go to JIRA home{noformat}

h4. Actual result

The message isn't encoded properly:

{noformat}
Problem communicating with JIRA: Forbidden (403) Encountered a "403 - Forbidden" error while loading this page. Go to JIRA home{noformat}

!2016-01-11_1045.png|thumbnail!

h4. Notes

The relevant error message in the FishEye/Crucible logs:

{noformat}
Caused by: com.atlassian.crowd.exception.ApplicationPermissionException: Forbidden (403) Encountered a "403 - Forbidden" error while loading this page. Go to JIRA home{noformat}

Full stack:

{noformat}

This feature is to make it easier for users to locate the specific locations within individual files with text search results can be found.

For Example:

If the word "up" can be found 10 times within a file, then the search results will provide line numbers for each match within the file and a link to show in the source where each match was found.

fields.description:
h4. Scenario
When doing the initial scan FishEye is indexing repository tags. There is a time limit for processing tags: MAX_TAG_PROCESSING_TIME = 10 minutes.
When FishEye stops indexing tags because of this time limit and the repository has no new commits that would trigger a re-index, the missing tags will be never processed. FishEye is in a state, that it assumes that the initial scan was finished and waiting for new commits.

h4. Fix
When stopping indexing tags because of the time limit, mark that this process has to be resumed.

h4. Workaround
Create a dummy branch and push dummy commits - this will trigger indexing, including indexing missing tags. Repeat until all missing tags have been indexed.
fields.summary: GIT - missing tags in FishEye after initial scan

fields.description:
*Condition*
* Be logged in a user who's a non-admin user.
* Be logged in as the password-only administrator.

*Steps to Reproduce*
# Go to {{FishEye Administration > Application Link}} and *edit* its configuration.
# In *Incoming Authentication*, go to the *OAuth* tab, set the *Execute As* field to the non-admin user who you are logged as, and click on *Update*

*Expected Result*
* The user will be properly set on the *Execute As* field.

*Actual Result*
* The error message "The user must not be a System Administrator" is thrown.

*Workaround*
Logout completely from FishEye, then login just with the password-only Administrator (or another admin user), and try setting the user on the Application Link configuration again.
fields.summary: Application Link "Execute As" setting throws "The user must not be a System Administrator", even though the user isn't an admin

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When configuring the parameters for JMX using {{$FISHEYE_OPTS}} it will prevent the {{stop.sh}} script from running as it will try to spin up another JMX server and cause a conflict.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Configure {{FISHEYE_OPTS}} with the following options:
{code}FISHEYE_OPTS='-Dcom.sun.management.jmxremote -Dcom.sun.management.jmxremote.port=8061 -Dcom.sun.management.jmxremote.authenticate=false -Dcom.sun.management.jmxremote.ssl=false'{code}
# Export {{FISHEYE_OPTS}}
{code}export FISHEYE_OPTS{code}
# Start FishEye using {{start.sh}}
# Stop FishEye using {{stop.sh}} and observe the error

h3. Expected Results

JMX is available and the {{start.sh}} and {{stop.sh}} scripts work without error.

h3. Actual Results
The following error is thrown when running {{stop.sh}}:
{code}./stop.sh
Error: Exception thrown by the agent : java.rmi.server.ExportException: Port already in use: 8061; nested exception is:
        java.net.BindException: Address already in use{code}

h3. Workaround

Shutdown FishEye using the web UI under {{Administration >> System Settings >> Shutdown}}.
fields.summary: When configuring JMX in FISHEYE_OPTS, stopping FishEye fails
Integration with JIRA broken after upgrade to JIRA 7

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When indexing a Perforce repository, FishEye tries to retrieve the blame information for a file even when the file has already been marked as too large.

Since the file has already been marked as too large, the retrieval of the blame information may be skipped so to that the indexing process is optimized.

The following log snippet shows that FishEye first identifies that the file size is exceeding the limit:
{noformat}
WARN  [IncrPing1 repository_name ] fisheye RepositoryConfig-isOfIndexableSize - [repository_name] pathtofile/filename exceeds indexing size limit (10M, limit is 5M).  The contents of this file won't be searchable in FishEye.
{noformat}

Afterwards, it still tries to retrieve the blame information by performing a perforce command.


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create or modify a large file in your Perforce repository (more than 5M)
# When FishEye indexes the file, FishEye will try to retrieve the blame information

h3. Expected Results
FishEye does not try to retrieve the blame information, in case the file has already

h3. Actual Results
FishEye tries to retrieve the blame information anyway.
 
h3. Notes
The retrieval of the blame information ({{p4 annote}} command) could fail as well depending on the {{dm.annotate.maxsize}} settings. If this is the case, please refer to [this Knowledge base article|https://confluence.atlassian.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=794498782].
fields.summary: As an administrator, I don't want FishEye to retrieve the blame information for a file already marked as too large in a Perforce repository, so that the indexing process is optimized

fields.description:
Created as a follow-up of https://fisheye.dev.internal.atlassian.com/cru/CR-FE-9776#c101109.

When collecting data about an {{add}} changelist at the root level in {{Svn2Infill2Processor#summarizeRootDiff}}, we must immediately ignore the excluded files from {{Svn2ChangesetDiffSummary}}. This became apparent when we fixed importing files from outside the repo in FE-6274. This resulted in redundant {{svn cat}} and {{svn proplist}} calls for excluded files that were later on ignored anyway.
fields.summary: Ignore excluded files as early as possible in Svn2Infill2Processor
